description: From Latin detectus, perfect passive participle of detegere (“to uncover or disclose”), from de- + tegere (“to cover”); see tegument, tile, thatch.

verbs.description: detect (third-person singular simple present detects, present participle detecting, simple past and past participle detected)

entries.meaning: To discover or find by careful search, examination, or probing.

verbs.description: detect (third-person singular simple present detects, present participle detecting, simple past and past participle detected)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, informal) To work or solve cases as a detective.
